configuration.stem: Choose the best terms to complete the statement.

feedBack.firstWrongHint: Remember that negative feedback helps animals maintain homeostasis.
feedBack.finalWrongHint: Positive feedback increases the effect of a stimulus while negative feedback inhibits the effect of a stimulus. Negative feedback loops help animals maintain homeostasis within their body systems.

configuration.paragraph: <<Option1>> feedback strengthens the effect of a stimulus.  <<Option2>> feedback slows the effect of a stimulus. A dog responds to the stimulus of feeling hot by panting. When the dog cools down, the dog will stop panting. The control of the dogâ€™s body temperature is an example of <<Option3>>feedback.
